title.narrative: Understanding Trafficking of Birds in the Middle East

description.narrative: (1) estimating the number of birds trafficked in target countries the Middle East through market surveys; (2) determining the natal origins or breeding grounds of key avian taxa trafficked in the Middle East, using stable isotopes and GPS telemetry; and (3) communicating this information to support enhanced conservation, management, and enforcement actions.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: CATALYZING CHEETAH CONSERVATION THROUGH LAW ENFORCEMENT AND DEMAND REDUCTION EFFORTS IN THE ARABIAN PENINSULA

description.narrative: ILLEGAL TRAFFICKING OF LIVE CHEETAHS FOR THE PET TRADE, ZOO, AND OTHER WILDLIFE-BASED ATTRACTIONS REPRESENTS AN EXISTENTIAL THREAT TO THE SPECIES. THE DRIVERS OF THE PET TRADE ARE COMPLEX, VARIED, AND INADEQUATELY RESEARCHED. CHEETAH HAVE BEEN TRADED AND KEPT AS PETS FOR CENTURIES BUT THE CURRENT ITERATION OF THIS PRACTICE OCCURS AGAINST THE BACKDROP OF SIGNIFICANT POPULATION DECLINE, HABITAT LOSS, AND THE WIDESPREAD CULTURAL PERMEATION OF SOCIAL MEDIA, SUPERCHARGING DEMAND AND AVAILABILITY AND MAKING THE SURVIVAL OF THE SPECIES HIGHLY UNCERTAIN. TO DATE, MOST ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS THE ISSUE HAVE FOCUSED ON THE SUPPLY SIDE AND ON LAW ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS TO DISRUPT TRAFFICKING. LESS FOCUS HAS BEEN ON ADDRESSING OR UNDERSTANDING THE DRIVERS OF DEMAND, ESPECIALLY USING THE LENS OF SOCIAL BEHAVIOR CHANGE COMMUNICATIONS SBCC , WITH ITS EMPHASIS ON SPECIFIC AUDIENCE IDENTIFICATION AND DISAGGREGATION AND HYPER-TARGETED MESSAGING AS OPPOSED TO BROAD AWARENESS RAISING CAMPAIGNS . IFAW WILL LEVERAGE TRUSTED RELATIONSHIPS IN THE KINGDOM OF SAUDI ARABIA - THE MOST POPULOUS COUNTRY IN THE ARABIAN PENINSULA - TO BLEND LAW ENFORCEMENT CAPACITY BUILDING WITH FORMATIVE RESEARCH INTO THE DRIVERS OF DEMAND AND INITIAL EFFORTS TO TACKLE IT. BY ADDRESSING BOTH THE INSTITUTIONAL PRIORITIES OF NATIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND DEV
